parameters:
What's the matter, Karin? That's not the way to Edo! If you
keep dawdling, Edo will burn to the ground!

Warning: You cannot return once you proceed. Will you
advance to Mount Fuji?
Fully prepared! Let's head to Mount Fuji now
準備万端！　このまま富士山へ進む

The Sea of Trees... is that what it's called? It's my first
time here, but it's full of nature with rocks and tall
trees...

The Forest of Spirits also had many trees, but this
place is even more densely overgrown. Perhaps due to the
eruption, there are pockets of lava here and there.

We should still expect many more demons ahead. If we're to
proceed, we must do so with caution.

It seems they've already shown themselves, haven't they? We
might not be able to return. Let's brace ourselves and
defeat these creatures.

By Lord Gyoun's command, you shall not pass any further!
Die, intruders!!
Move aside! I won't let you interfere!

Hmph! They may be sturdier than the demons that attacked
Edo, but they are no match for us! Clear the way,
scoundrels--!

...These demons were once humans, handpicked by Gyoun.
Indeed, they feel like much stronger adversaries than
before.
Handpicked...? What do you mean by that?

When humans become demons, they are imbued with demonic
power, which is proportional to their original abilities and
strength--in other words, if an ordinary villager becomes a
demon, it's one thing, but if a master swordsman or expert
becomes a demon, then...

They become demons of unparalleled strength, far surpassing
ordinary ones.

The demons protecting this Mount Fuji were once strong
individuals when they were human. They seem to be like an
elite guard for Gyoun.

To turn humans into demonkin, he uses a demon seed. However,
since they are made to follow orders as demons, they
surprisingly lack the ability to adapt in battle. They're
like living puppets.

Is that why he has Kotaro and the other elite of the Fuma
ninjas under his command?

We survivors of the Fuma are exceptional beings who ate the
flesh of demons ourselves. Therefore, we have far greater
abilities and judgment than the demonkin who were implanted
with demon seeds and became Gyoun's minions. That's why we
were called the Eight Grudge War Demons and were highly
valued by Gyoun.

I see. But it's thanks to the strong remnants of your egos
that you were able to defy Gyoun and part ways with him.

If that story is true... then all the demons we've defeated
so far were once humans like Momiji-san...? I thought I was
slaying demons that harm people, but unknowingly, I was
actually taking the lives of people who were once human with
these hands...

(I've tried not to think about it until now... but the
demons were indeed once human. If I had been turned into
one... by now I would be...)

Both of you, I understand how you feel, but there's no need
to be deeply troubled. If they retained a human heart like
Momiji, it would be one thing, but once fully transformed
into demonkin, they are no longer human but demons
themselves--

The ones turned into demons had their human lives destroyed
by Gyoun's hand and were forced into a fate of living as
demons against their will... Do not think of it as killing
people. Think of it as saving them from the evil path of
demons... It's easier on the conscience that way.

...Yeah, I'll try to think of it that way. Thank you,
Masaki-chan.

I can't forgive Gyoun even more now. I will make sure he
pays for his crimes.
The ground has started shaking again!? We must hurry...!
Let's go put an end to this cursed ritual started by Gyoun!
--Karin and the four others have stormed into Mount Fuji!

The bridge over the river is under repair. You cannot
proceed further, so it would be best to return to Edo.
(Oh dear, what a shame... I'll try again next time.)

(It looks like we can climb Mount Fuji from here. But it
seems to be off-limits.)

(It seems I can't go any deeper into the forest because a
large tree is blocking the way...)
Sorry to keep you waiting, Yugiri-chan!

Yugiri: "...You're late, Karin! I've been waiting here for
\V[137] days, you know?"

Karin: "I... I'm so sorry, Yugiri-chan! I really apologize
for making you wait!"

Yugiri: "...Before we head to Suranamu Village, there's a
place I'd like to stop by. Is that okay?"

Karin: "Whose grave is this that you're offering flowers
to...?"

Yugiri: "It's the grave of my master—the former head of the
Iga ninja and his comrades. They fought demons here at this
garrison half a year ago and were... killed by the demons.
Nearly 40 of our comrades as well."

Karin: "Is that so? I remember hearing that many of the Iga
ninja were decimated by demons... So this was where that
battle took place?"

Yugiri: "He was a skilled man, but the enemy was a
malevolent demon. He was killed and never returned. Since
then... it's been since then that the shogunate recognized
the existence of demons and we Iga ninja were tasked with
searching for and defeating them—"

Karin: "So, the reason why only the magistrate's office has
been chasing me until now is..."

Yugiri: "Because we, the elite Iga ninja, were preoccupied
with dealing with demons. In a way, the fact that Karin was
left at large is also related to the demons. If the Iga
ninja had been in charge of the Nezumi Komachi from the start,
we might have captured you quite quickly."

Karin: "Right... I managed to escape because it was only the
magistrate's office, but if from the beginning it had been
Yugiri-chan and the other ninja in charge of security, I
might have been caught right away... Let me also pay my
respects."

--Karin and Yugiri joined their hands in prayer before the
grave in silence.

Yugiri: "Now that we've paid our respects at the grave,
let's hurry to Suranamu Village."

Yugiri: "Alright, let's go, Karin--Suranamu Village is just
ahead."

Yugiri: "...Before we head to Suranamu Village, there's a
place I'd like to stop by. Is that okay?"

Karin: "Whose grave is this that you're offering flowers
to...?"

Yugiri: "It's the grave of my master—the former head of the
Iga ninja and his comrades. They fought demons here at this
garrison half a year ago and were... killed by the demons.
Nearly 40 of our comrades as well."

Karin: "Is that so? I remember hearing that many of the Iga
ninja were decimated by demons... So this was where that
battle took place?"

Yugiri: "He was a skilled man, but the enemy was a
malevolent demon. He was killed and never returned. Since
then... it's been since then that the shogunate recognized
the existence of demons and we Iga ninja were tasked with
searching for and defeating them—"

Karin: "So, the reason why only the magistrate's office has
been chasing me until now is..."

Yugiri: "Because we, the elite Iga ninja, were preoccupied
with dealing with demons. In a way, the fact that Karin was
left at large is also related to the demons. If the Iga
ninja had been in charge of the Nezumi Komachi from the start,
we might have captured you quite quickly."

Karin: "Right... I managed to escape because it was only the
magistrate's office, but if from the beginning it had been
Yugiri-chan and the other ninja in charge of security, I
might have been caught right away... Let me also pay my
respects."

--Karin and Yugiri joined their hands in prayer before the
grave in silence.

Yugiri: "Now that we've paid our respects at the grave,
let's hurry to Suranamu Village."
--Yugiri and Momiji have joined the party!
...What? Are you planning to return to Edo, Karin?

We'll be waiting here. Please come back after you've
finished your business in Edo.

...Honestly, I'm not fond of this village. If you're going
in, I'll wait here. I'll only join the fight when it's time
to face the enemy.

Are you taking a detour again...? Isn't there anything else
to do? I'll be waiting here, so hurry back.

Karin! Now is not the time for detours! We must hurry to
Edo!

...Hmm? Are we making a detour to such a remote village?
We'll be waiting outside.
